title: Property Investors Swap Office Blocks for Data Centers
sub_head: Last year, the likes of Blackstone and KKR spent a record $47 billion on data-storage assets, even as rents came under pressure
body:
Real-estate investors are pulling cash out of offices and putting it into data centers as a hedge against the impact of remote working. But data centers have their own problems with oversupply and demanding tenants.
Interest in data centers has been growing for years, but took a big leap forward as the pandemic pushed more daily life online. One measure is acquisitions: Global data center deals hit a record $47.1 billion in 2021, according to Synergy Research Group, more than three times 2019â€™s tally and up from $34.5 billion in 2020.
